availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hiram Woodruff (Caldwell County, Kentucky, miller and farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, miller and farmer. South Carolina native. Married to Lydia Woodruff. Father of Lydia A. Woodruff, David H. Woodruff, Eliza J. Woodruff, John W. Woodruff, Cynthia A. Woodruff, Mary E. Woodruff, Nancy E. Woodruff, Martha A. Woodruff Mason, William Woodruff, Thomas Woodruff, Joseph Woodruff, Josephine Woodruff, Victoria Woodruff, and Lewis Woodruff. Resident of Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1830. Resident of Caldwell County in 1840. Miller in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Died in Caldwell County on December 25, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Fifth Manuscript Census of the United States (1830), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 40.
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, p. 5.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 347A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 73-74.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546374, p. 163.
Find A Grave, "Hiram Woodruff (1805-1865)," Memorial #89887260, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89887260 (accessed April 7, 2021).
